title: Boulter & De Minaur reveal engagement
description: Alex de Minaur and Katie Boulter will be rivals at the United Cup for the second consecutive year when Australia faces Great Britain on 1 January. But this edition's clash will be slightly different. The longtime partners are now engaged. The couple announced the news on social media Monday. "Weâ€™ve been keeping a small secretâ€¦ ðŸ¤­," Boulter wrote on Instagram. The post included a selfie of the duo in which Boulter was sporting an engagement ring. Â  Â  Â  Â  View this post on Instagram Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  A post shared by Katie Boulter (@katiecboulter) Many of their colleagues quickly congratulated the couple on their engagement, including Emma Raducanu, Denis Shapovalov, Thanasi Kokkinakis, Madison Keys, Marta Kostyuk, Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and many more. De Minaur and Boulter are both beginning their season in Sydney at the mixed teams event.Â  Australia begins its run against Argentina on the evening of 28 December. Great Britain faces Argentina on 30 December before Australia and Great Britain meet on 1 January. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Player News

Newly engaged couple to meet in United Cup

December 23, 2024

Beatriz Velasco/Getty Images

Katie Boulter and Alex de Minaur attended the Laureus World Sport Awards earlier this year. By ATP Staff

Alex de Minaur and Katie Boulter will be rivals at the United Cup for the second consecutive year when Australia faces Great Britain on 1 January. But this edition's clash will be slightly different.

The longtime partners are now engaged. The couple announced the news on social media Monday.

"Weâ€™ve been keeping a small secretâ€¦ ðŸ¤­," Boulter wrote on Instagram. The post included a selfie of the duo in which Boulter was sporting an engagement ring.

Many of their colleagues quickly congratulated the couple on their engagement, including Emma Raducanu, Denis Shapovalov, Thanasi Kokkinakis, Madison Keys, Marta Kostyuk, Alejandro Davidovich Fokina and many more.

De Minaur and Boulter are both beginning their season in Sydney at the mixed teams event.Â 

Australia begins its run against Argentina on the evening of 28 December. Great Britain faces Argentina on 30 December before Australia and Great Britain meet on 1 January.
